Judul: SIMULATION OF SHIP‐GENERATED WAVES IN WATERWAY USING HAWASSIVBM (STUDY CASE: CIKARANG BEKASI LAUT INLAND WATERWAY)
Abstrak:
Large ships that pass narrow and shallow waterways generate a drawdown followed by secondary 

waves that can disturb ships that are moored along the route. The response of a moored ship to these waves 

will depend on the magnitude and character of the long waves that reach it, which depend on the size, speed 

and closeness of the passing ship, its sailing line within the channel, the proportion of the channel cross‐section 

taken up by the ship, the channel geometry and bathymetry. The drawdown and secondary waves are expected 

to be generated by barges that sail in Cikarang Bekasi Laut Inland Waterways. Aim of this thesis is to simulate 

the waves that is generated by passing barges in Cikarang Bekasi Laut Inland Waterway, and determine the 

optimum speed limit for passing barges in CBL Inland Waterway. Numerical simulations of ship‐generated 

waves are conducted using a moving pressure method that has been packaged in a software, HAWASSI‐VBM. 

Several test cases that are compared with measurement data are conducted to validate the model. In order to 

investigate the impact of ship‐generated waves on on‐going loading/unloading operation by moored ship, 

maximum wave height at loading/unloading area is calculated and compared to the allowable criteria. From 

the result, it is found that HAWASSI‐VBM can decently predicted ship‐generated waves. Speed of 4 m/s (8 knots) 

in CBL Inland Waterway generate waves below the allowable criteria with predicted maximum wave height of 

0.425 m, and acceleration of 0.2 m/s2 from zero speed.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing:
Pembimbing : 

Entin Agustini Karjadi, Ph.D. 

Dr. Ruddy Kurnia.
Kata Kunci: Variational Boussinesq Model, Cikarang Bekasi Laut Inland Waterway, ship‐generated waves, speed limit.
